headline: Irresistible Pecan Pie
description: This is the most amazing pecan pie. Once you start eating it you can't stop.

video.description: See how to make a sweet, rich, totally irresistible pecan pie.
video.name: Irresistible Pecan Pie

name: Irresistible Pecan Pie

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

To Make Crust: In a medium bowl, combine flour, salt and white sugar. Cut butter into flour mixture until it resembles coarse crumbs. Gradually sprinkle the water over the dry mixture, stirring until dough comes together enough to form a ball.
On a floured surface flatten dough ball with rolling pin. Roll out into a circle that is one inch larger than pie dish. Place pie shell into dish and refrigerate until pie filling is complete.

To Make Pie Filling: In a medium bowl, mix together eggs, light and dark corn syrups, brown sugar, butter, salt and finely crushed pecans. Spread quartered pecans over bottom of refrigerated pie crust. Pour syrup mixture over top of pecans, then arrange pecan halves on top of pie.
Bake in a preheated 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) oven for one hour or until firm; let cool for one hour before serving.

review.reviewBody: It was average. Coming from the Northeast part of the US, maple syrup is abundant so I use dark maple syrup instead of karo syrup. I find the maple flavor takes it over the top and it has more nutritional value.
I have made this every year for almost 12 years. I will never make a different recipe as this is by far the favorite dish for anyone who likes pie.
One of the things that makes this pie different is the use of three different textures of pecans. I didn’t have any light syrup and used all dark, delicious.

Amazing! We added a few chocolate chips, which took this pie to another level. I can't believe how scrumptious this crust turned out! Usually, pie crust goes unnoticed, but this one makes a statement!

I followed the base recipe, but made my own tweaks to it. My family doesn't consume corn syrup. instead of corn syrup, I used honey (real) and molasses. I also candied the pecans with 2tbs of butter, 2tbs of light brown sugar and 1/4tsp of cinnamon in a small fry pan. I didn't use the quartered pecans, I thought the crushed and halved were plenty.
I made the recipe as is and not only was it the prettiest pecan pie I've ever seen, it was the best tasting pecan pie I've ever had!
Delicious- loved by all. Thank you

By far, the BEST pecan pie I've ever made & tasted. Most are way to sweet, but this pie was so good! Perfect light sweetness, buttery filling, plenty of crunchy pecans. My family gave rave reviews! 
*I did not have dark corn syrup, so just added 2T more of light. I also used a store-bought crust, but made sure to chill it in the pie plate before adding the filling.
Best pie I ever made and I have been baking pecan pies for 48 years! Thanks.
Absolutely hands down the best pecan pie we’ve ever eaten. Amazing!
oh my goodness!!!
Delicious! came out perfectly

I found the recipes for both the crust and the filling easy to follow and super easy to make. I made no changes since this was the first time I tried this recipe and the results were absolutely perfect. My only warning; DON'T use deep dish 9 in. pie pans! I was making 4 pies and had to make 2 extra batches to "top them off" as they'd have been too shallow!
Could use a little vanilla and try using your own go-to pie shell recipe instead of this one, otherwise, delicious and beautiful!

Loved this recipe's simplicity. 

For anyone who wants healthier option, I replaced butter with plant-based butter and corn syrup with honey, and still produced a delicious pie!
It was scrumptious. It wasn’t super sweet, so I think it was better than most.
This is the best pecan pie we have ever made. We used Marie Calendar pie crust, though.
Very easy to make! I opted to use a pre made crust and it turned out perfect! Everyone loved this recipe!
So easy and looks beautiful! I used a frozen crust instead of making my own and it worked out fine. Already getting requests for repeats from family members!
It turned out great. Crust was nice and the perfect color and everyone enjoined it
This pie was great! Everyone loved it . I only made one but I should have made more, They would definitely been gone.

This pie has been perfection for me since I found this recipe 3yrs ago. The only change I made was I used dark brown sugar and I toasted the pecans to draw more of their sweetness out before adding them to the rest of the ingredients.
My crust was a little tough but other than that it is an amazing recipe! Thank you for sharing.
Definitely Will make it again!

Haven't cut into it yet, but the top looks golden, but dry. I hope deeper in is more liquidy. My mom pointed out that using a pan underneath is important not just for collecting overflow, but helping to evenly cook the bottom of the crust. I forgot to put in the vanilla, like many other cooks suggested! I hope the flavor is ok!
Also added some vanilla, but great every time!!

I've made this recipe 2 years in a row for the holidays and am now known as "the pecan pie lady" by family members because of how incredible this is. It is so easy and SO tasty! I'm excited to make it again this year!

I have made this now twice and it is really good! I used pillsbury dough for crust but followed the recipe and suggested add ins a dash of cinnamon, 2 tsp vanilla, and a tbsp of flour. It doesn't last a full 24 hours in our house.
My family loves this recipe, so I make it every holiday.
Very Good. Will make this again.

I saw a review that suggested adding vanilla, cinnamon and flour. While this is the very first time my middle wasn't runny, it ended up being too thick. I would back off the cinnamon, keep the vanilla, and not add the flour next go around. Overall, I enjoyed it, but want to tweek it a bit more.
I just made thus recipe. Hope it tastes as good as it looks.

Made this for my son-in-law, he loved that there was so much pecan taste and that it was not too sweet. I used my favorite pie crust recipe but used the directions of the filling from the original recipe.

Absolutely wonderful recipe. Taking the time to find the most perfect pecan halves for the top really made a difference in how delicious the pie looked. Unfortunately, because it looked so good, I only got a single piece!

This is by far the best Pecan Pie I have ever baked. I liked the amount of pecans in the pie along with the chopping into two different sizes. Topped off with pecan halves. The filling balanced well with the 2 1/2 cups of pecans. The filling often times can be way too sweet. After a good sized meal over powering sweetness can distract from the dessert. This will now be my go to Pecan Pie! Up date, I just read a few of the reviews. Vanilla was mentioned a lot. I did add 1 teaspoon of vanilla to my pie because I felt like a little bit of vanilla never hurts anything!

This turned out awesome!! Not gooey in the middle at all! Added the vanilla and cinnamon suggested in other reviews. 
Highly recommend this recipe.
My husband is a bit picky when it comes to Pecan Pie. He LOVED this one! I probably added a wee bit more vanilla than everyone suggested, but the vanilla makes it amazing!
YUMMY and EASY! I added an egg and used half dark half light syrup

This is a holiday favorite and requested by my family every year! I add an extra 1/2 cup of crushed pecans to the filling. Sometimes I will use substitute eggs instead of the real eggs, with no noticeable difference.
I made this pie for Thanksgiving and my family really enjoyed it. I used a pre-made crust to save on time.
So GOOD and easy!
Added Tuaca & Vanilla extract
I have this this recipe twice and it was perfect just how it is!

LOVE!!! (I am an AWFUL cook - so if I can make this pie well - any baker can!) I have made this recipe several times for my hubby who is infatuated with pecan pie. Next time I make it I will be taking other bakers recommendations and adding 1T of flour so its not deliciously mushy. I printed this recipe about 15 years ago and every time I make it - its a huge hit and gobbled up immediately.

I make the filling as is, but I just can't get pie crusts to come out well. Then I substitute for Pilsbury's refrigerated pie crust. Only thing I change and this pie is my go-to whenever I want to impress guests!
Made this just as written and it was a total smash with our friends! So easy and delicious; will make again and again!
This recipe is absolutely delicious!!! No tweaks needed! I’ve been looking for a nutty recipe and I’m so glad I stumbled here. Thank you so much for your recipe definitely making this again!

Oh my goodness. This was amazing. Followed the recipe as written though adjusted according to my convection oven. My partners favourite treat and he says is the best he's ever had. 10 star if I could.
Rich flavour without being super sweet. A great beginner pie. My niece made it as her first and is already asking for the recipe!!

Very good. Next time I will reduce pecans by 1/2 cup..just too many so it overpowers filling. I did add 2 tablespoons flour & vanilla. Definitely do that again. Also, I think 50 minutes would have been a better bake time for my electric oven. I hour made it a little dry. I would absolutely make it again. Like all recipes you can tweak it to fit your individual taste.
This is now my favorite pecan pie recipe! Simply perfect
This is the best Pecan Pie recipe out there. My husband always asks for more pecans, this is just bursting with pecans!

This is my go to recipe now. I don't personally enjoy it, but those in my family who do expect it at every holiday. They won't eat any homemade pecan pie unless it's this recipe. Consistency is on point, flavor is delicious, you can't go wrong. However I cannot say that I've tried the crust. With all the other food to cook I have used a premade pie crust and it's worked well each time.

My husband generally does not like pecan pie, claiming it is too sweet. But he raved about this one, noting that you could really taste the pecans. Placing pecan halves on the top really makes for a lovely presentation too. I have already made it again!
It was beautiful and easy to make but my husband said it had too many nuts in it. So next time I will put less, but oh my it was pretty.
Great recipe. I thought I didn’t like pecan pie but have now changed my mind :) I did add vanilla, cinnamon and a dash of nutmeg as recommended by reviewers. Can’t wait to make this again.

Great Pie.
I've made this pie five times now. My family expects this pie at our holiday functions, and I'm glad to make them happy. I haven't changed a thing. 
Thank You

I made a pie following the recipe to a T and then I made one with cinnamon, tbl flour, and vanilla and I could not tell any difference whatsoever. I froze one of the pies and it reheated just as well as when it was fresh. I simply baked it at 350 for 20-30 mins until the center was warm. Great recipe, thanks! :)

Oh I forgot to mention I lied... I guess I did change the recipe. I did honey instead of dark corn syrup and I instead of light corn syrup I just dissolved sugar into hot water. I doubt it changed the taste, but I felt better about it!
I followed the recipe exactly but used non-dairy margarine and Ener-G kosher egg replacer. This pie is hands down the best pecan pie I’ve had yet.

I don't believe it's fair to make numerous changes to a recipe and then rate the results as if you had followed the recipe. For this reason I ignored all suggested changes and tried the recipe as written. Glad I did! This pie is excellent--not too sweet as many pecan pies can be. Will definitely try again.

It was my first attempt at pecan pie. This is a great recipe for a beginner. It’s simple and really no way you can mess it up. The pie tasted wonderful. Not overwhelming sweet like some pecan pies. This will be a new addition to my holiday baking. Thanks for the recipe!!
I followed the suggestion to add 2t vanilla, 1t cinnamon and 1T flour. Turned out perfect!
Don't forget to add a teaspoon of vanilla as suggested by other raters!
I made the recipe for Thanksgiving. Fabulous. I carmalized the topping pecans with butter and maple syrup.

Perfection! I suggest either pushing the topped pecans down into the filling or mixing in with a little batter from the bowl before placing on top, otherwise the pecans will burn! I added 1/2 tsp vanilla since my old recipe called for it. (I had been adding crushed pecans to mine to get the perfect filling consistency, but forget every year at Thanksgiving just how much, so I thought to check AllRecipes for a new recipe. I'm so glad I did!) This is my new go-to pecan pie recipe. Thank you so much!
I have made this recipe for Thanksgiving for the last several years (10 or more). Everyone loves it, and it always turns out great.
This is a great recipe, I did change a one things ; Like others need to add vanilla. I used only chopped pecans in pie and 1/2’s on top . Thanks for sharing this delicious recipe.

I use molasses instead of dark corn syrup. I also use my own pie crust recipe.
I have made this pie for the past few years, and it is always everyone's favorite pecan pie! We love the amount of pecans in it!
I’d give this 10 stars if I could! The best ever!
Yes making it again right now!
Had good flavor but was too thick.
It was just incredible !!!!! the best pie I've ever made . Turns out great every time .
Easy to follow, and it was delicious while it lasted.
I used Crisco in the crust instead of butter, I think it make the crust a little more flakey. I was really good.
I did not make any changes. It is a fantastic pie!

This pie turned out delicious!! I only had enough pecans to decorate the top, but I had plenty of walnuts, so I tried those and they were just as good as pecans in the pie. I used another person's suggestions to add 1 tbs flour and I added 2 tsp. vanilla. I also used dark brown sugar because it's what I had on hand. It was the best "pecan" pie I had even eaten. So good! I will definitely be making this recipe again.

Delicious rich filling. I used all white corn syrup and soft, instead of melted butter.. I always add 1 teaspoon vanilla extract to pecan pie recipes. I'm not sure why it's ommitted but we prefer it. I had to use a GF crust for dietary reasons so didn't test the r
I found there was way too many pecans in the pie. I did add the vanilla, cinnamon, and flour as suggested in the comments but this just wasn't as good of a recipe as I'd thought it'd be.
Delicious and easy to make.
It was delicious and everyone loved it
I followed the recipe, but added vanilla as some had suggested. My husband and two sons said it was the best pecan pie they had tasted. This will be my go to recipe for pecan pie.

Very, very good! I did take the suggestions and added a tablespoon of flour and a teaspoon and a half of vanilla. Did use the crust recipe. It didn't get soggy and tasted good. Loved all the pecans. Rave reviews at Thanksgiving.

I found it a little confusing that the pie crust ingredients weren't well separated from the pie ingredients, but the resulting pie was fabulous and the pecans arranged on the top made it look stunning!!

This review is for the filling only; I used a different pie crust recipe. I made two changes: as many people mentioned, I added 1 tsp vanilla & secondly I changed the amount of pecan nuts used- in the filling itself I used 1 cup of chopped pecans and then for the top, added just enough whole pecans to cover the surface. This recipe is definitely a keeper and I'll use it again!
It had a good flavor it was very nutty which I liked, and the vanilla added a great taste, but I think I baked it too long

Everyone wanted seconds. I added 2 tablespoons of cane syrup, generous teaspoon vanilla extract, used 2/4 cup light and 1/4 cup dark corn syrup, and 1 teaspoon cinimion. 
I will definitely make this pie again.
For a deep dish pie pan double the filling recipe. I have to hide this pie every time I make it from hubby. Its outstanding!
I make this every year or anytime someone wants a good pecan pie. It never lasts long in my house. :)
No changes. It came out good. Crust was a little hard.

I have tried a few other Pecan Pie recipes and this is by far my favorite. I used my own crust recipe and added 1 1/2 tsp of vanilla and 1 TBS of flour to the filling as suggested by others and it turned out perfectly the first time! This is now my go-to Pecan Pie recipe!

I've done what the others have suggested. I added 1 1/2 tsp. of vanilla extract, a dash of cinnamon, and 1 Tbsp. of flour to the filling. I also skipped the step where you add 1 cup of quarter-pecans to the bottom of the crust and put only as many pecans on top as I wanted (which probably turned out to be a cup, anyway) so that I did not have too many pecans. Lastly, I pulled out the pie after 30 minutes and covered it with aluminum foil (if I hadn't, I think that it may have burned). I have not tried it as it is the pie is not for me, but my family keeps complimenting it and saying that it looks good. I think it looks good as well. This pie recipe may be good yet!!! :)
HUGE Hit! I was told this is the "Best Pecan Pie I've ever eaten" by several people. Made it for Thanksgiving 2015.

This was a huge hit! I made it for a friend who loves pecan pie, but it ended up being the favorite pie of the night, even amongst us that usually aren't pecan pie fans!

Substitutions:
• Instead of making this pie crust, I bought Keebler Ready Crust 9 Inch Shortbread Pie Crust and it balanced the pie nicely
• I added 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla
• I didn't decorate the top with pecans. This was mostly out of time restraint but taste-wise, it already had plenty of pecans and was incredible, plus it wasn't ugly to need the top.

This is an EXCELLENT pie recipe!!!! 
I used pilsberry pie crust prerolled in the buscuit section. So I can only review the filling and process. 
 I didn't leave it in for the whole hour the first time and it turned out PERFECT. It was about 50 minutes. The second time I left it in for the entire hour and it was way too done. Hard to serve and very tough. 
Just make sure to watch this pie closely for the remaining 15 minutes.
I didn't use this pie crust recipe - so can only rate the filling which was simple and amazing. I didn't put in as many of the pecan pieces as it called for but that's a personal preference.

Have made this many times. Always great. However, I make the following changes:
1) add 1 teaspoon of cinnamon,
2) add 2 teaspoons of vanilla, and
3) add 1 tablespoon of flour. I also cover with foil after about 20 mins to stop the nuts and edge of the crust from burning / overcooking.
Waaaay too many pecans. Very overwhelming. Will not make again.

This is a pie for pecan lovers only. My husband was over the moon for this pie. It has amazing flavor without being too sweet if you use all the pecans requested. I will only use the recipe for pecan pie for now on. Thank you for this.
I made it with store bought crust because I wanted to try it an it is AMAZING
